description: Snap version saves zero-length videos, and webcam doesn't work, and audio doesn't work, even with all Snap permissions turned On. This APT version, on the other hand, records and saves everything until it freezes. So, it is am improvement over the Snap version but it nevertheless also has some problems. Keep working on it. I like the concept and simplicity of this application.
summary: Apt version 3.0.2 working better than the Snap installed version 3.0.4

description:
It is very laggy on export 
DO not download this product
Using in Kubuntu 20.04. It just works perfectly.

It's work on my Ubuntu 20.04LTS HP Laptop with 8GBand 350GB Hard Drive and Intel Silver processor. But the only problem not audio recorder. But is fine to me. I am able to record full screeen when I play wormax2.io no problem not lag even When I play the game play with 0 lag
Ubuntu 20. Video ok, but without audio.

Nice simple and easy to use app for screen recording. It has a number of easy to change settings and the recordings are of high quality. This worked on a high resolution screen where some of the other screen recording apps failed. It has shortcut keys to Start, Stop and Pause the recording but these are fairly hidden and the app should make these more obvious for example when one clicks on the icon in the sys tray (the shortcut keys for the Start, Stop and Pause the recording should display.

The app can also view video from a webcam but there is no record or take a snapshot button (like for example in Cheese). I assume you launch the camera and then take a screen recording of the camera. This seems convoluted and its better to use Cheese directly for recording from a camera.

This app does the job and I can't complain about it. 

Only thing would be to allow to record directly in mp4 but that's ok ;)

I have used mutiple screen video/audio capture software in Windows XP and above. None of thes were as simple to use VokoscreenNG blows them all away. I have paid hundreds for Windows Video capture software and not found any that work this easy. Video and audio clarity are outstanding.
Crashes if recording > 1 hour... (in my case)
summary: Crashes if recording > 1 hour... (in my case)

summary: don't put your time on this app. frame rate is low

description: Great tool - easy and fast to use. Easy you can use few sources i.e. part of the monitor and attached camera on the sam screen. Good compresion.
summary: Great tool - easy and fast to use

description:
Other comments about easy to use are spot on but this tool has limitations. 
I tried playing a Youtube video on a browser to capture that video and the frame rate was a real problem. Slow jerky movement, audio drop outs, etc. were the norm no matter which format or frame rate I selected. I am using a laptop that has only adequate video hardware, so that could be the problem. 
This tool would be great for a tutorial say on how to use the Ubuntu Files app and would capture mouse movement, audio, and your screen view perfectly.
summary: Great for creating a tutorial, not good for online video capture

description: Feature-complete desktop recording software
Very poor audio and video sync
... highly recommended

App does actually work on my hardware using KDE Plasma Wayland:

MY KDE INFO:

Operating System: openSUSE Tumbleweed 20230412
KDE Plasma Version: 5.27.4
KDE Frameworks Version: 5.105.0
Qt Version: 5.15.8
Kernel Version: 6.2.9-1-default (64-bit)
Graphics Platform: Wayland
Processors: 4 × Intel® Core™ i5-3570K CPU @ 3.40GHz
Memory: 15.5 GiB of RAM
Graphics Processor: PITCAIRN

Im giving this app 3 stars

I will Give this app *more* stars when:

* Audio Support is implemeted
* Video Bitrate adjustment option is included

This app is doing what OBS Studio does NOT do for me under KDE Plasma Wayland
OBS only gives me a black screen
seamlessly does the job
